intro: Microcos barombiensis, commonly known as the Barombi microcosm, is a rare and unique flowering plant native to the Barombi-Koto region in Cameroon. It is characterized by its striking, large, and colorful flowers that bloom in a spiral pattern, resembling a miniature universe, hence its common name. The plant has narrow, linear leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in swampy or wetland habitats. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Microcos barombiensis is considered a vulnerable species.
